newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK stocks seen breaking more records on U.S. rates.
newsitem.headline: HK stocks seen breaking more records on U.S. rates.

text.p: Hong Kong stocks are expected to continue breaking records on Wednesday following Tuesday's decision by the U.S. Federal Reserve to leave interest rates unchanged, brokers said.
The Dow Industrials rose 74.58 points, or 1.03 percent, on the news to 7,303.46 on Tuesday.

"The Hong Kong market should continue to move higher on better overseas stocks and a stable interest rate environment since there are not too many negative factors around," said Ben Kwong, director of research at Dharmala Securities.
"It seems the index will again test new highs."
But the pace of the rise would be slower as fund managers turn a bit cautious at current price levels, Kwong said.
On Tuesday, the Hang Seng Index rose 127.38 points, or 0.90 percent, to a record close of 14,236.20. Later, the Hang Seng London Reference Index eased 32.95 points to 14,203.25.

Charles Cheung, executive director at J & A Securities, said profit-taking was expected later in the day since the rise on Tuesday indicated the market had discounted the interest rate factor. "The market may open up and gradually move down to close at the 14,000 level," he said.
